iwork.eheap2
Class Event

java.lang.Object
  iwork.eheap2.Tuple
      iwork.eheap2.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
FieldValueTypes
Direct Known Subclasses:
SecureEvent
public class Event
extends Tuple

This class represents events either retrieved from or to be placed into an Event Heap using the EventHeap class. It contains methods to add fields to an event, and set and get field values. The Event class is synchronized, so you may access it simultaneously from more than one thread.

The recommended way of creating your own events is to create sub-classes of Event. Subclasses of Event need to do three things in the constructor:

  • Call Super-Class:  Call the super class constructor first (in C++ super-class constructors are automatically called so you don't need to do this for the C++ version of the Event Heap). Calling the super-class constructor insures that all of the default fields are added.
  • Set fields:   Subclasses should set EVENTTYPE field to contain the unique name for your event type in string form. You can also overrride the default TIMETOLIVE value of 120000 ms (120 s). 
  • Add fields:   Subclasses should add all new fields for that event type in their constructor. Make sure to set all sub-fields appropriately for each field. See the field documentation for more details.
The following are the names of all of the defined fields and the default values for their sub-fields. The 'Post Value' sub-field contains the values that are sent when this event is posted (by the putEvent() method of EventHeap), and the 'Template Value' sub-field contains the value used when this event is used as a template. Some of the default fields have their value automatically set by the Event Heap. The 'Can be Overridden?' column indicates whether these automatically set values can be overridden. If allowable, as soon as client code calls a routine to set the post or template value of the sub-field, automatic setting of that field will be turned off.

Required Fields
Name Type Post Value Template Value Can be Overridden? Description
EventType String INVALID_EVENT Formal Must be overridden* In general, all events must have an event type. All events of the same type should contain the same minimum set of additional fields beyond the standard ones (but may contain additional fields beyond the minimum set).
TimeToLive Integer 120000 ms Formal Post value only. The amount of time after placement in the Event Heap until the event expires and becomes no longer retrievable.
Source String Set to Source of EventHeap object on posting Formal Template value only. Indicates which EventHeap object placed this event into the Event Heap. Only one Source of a given name may be active in an Event Heap at one time.
Target String Formal Set to Source of EventHeap object on template submission. Yes. The name of the of the Event Heap source for which this event is intended.
SourceApplication String Set to Application of EventHeap object on posting. Formal Template value only. The name of the application which generated this event. Event Heap clients will try to generate this automatically if it is not specified.
TargetApplication String Formal Set to Application of EventHeap object on template submission. Yes. The name of the application for which this event is intended.
SourceDevice String Set to Device of EventHeap object on posting. Formal Template value only. The name of the device which generated this event. Event Heap clients will generate this automatically from the DNS name or IP address of the device if it is not specified.
TargetDevice String Formal Set to Device of EventHeap object on template submission. Yes. The name of the device for which this event is intended.

Optional Fields
Name Type Post Value Template Value Can be Overridden? Description
SourcePerson String Virtual, or set to Person of EventHeap object, if non-null, on posting. Virtual Template value only. The person most directly responsible for the generation of this event, if known. This may be specified using the appropriate method call to the EventHeap client object.
TargetPerson String Formal Virtual, or set to Person of EventHeap object, if non-null, on posting. Yes. The person for whom this event is intended.
SourceGroup String Virtual, or set to Group of EventHeap object, if non-null, on posting. Virtual Template value only. The group which generated this event. This may be specified using the appropriate method call to the EventHeap client object.
TargetGroup String Formal Virtual, or set to Group of EventHeap object, if non-null, on template submission . Yes. The group for whom this event is intended.

Internal Fields
Name Type Post Value Template Value Can be Overridden? Description
SessionID Integer Set by EventHeap object on posting. Virtual No. Used for event sequencing.
SequenceNum Integer Set by EventHeap object on posting. Virtual No. Used for event sequencing.
EventHeapVersion Integer Set to Event Heap version of EventHeap object on posting. Set to Event Heap version of EventHeap object on posting. No. Used to insure event compatibility and allow for event versioning.
*both template and post values must be overridden to be the same.

Fields that have a 'Virtual' value for both post and template values are known as 'pure virtuals.' Any field that is pure virtual after the Event Heap client has set the values of internally set fields is stripped from the event when it is posted. If those events are subsequently retrieved from the Event Heap by another client, the pure virtual fields will no longer be present. On account of this, any fields that are pure virtual, or have the potential of becoming pure virtual cannot be assumed to be present in an event of a certain type. In other words, although a given EventType generally implies the presence of a collection of fields, if the values of both the post and template sub-fields have the potential of being virtual, the only thing implied is that it is possible for that particular field to be in the event included.

Constructor Detail

Event

public Event()
      throws EventHeapException
Creates a new Event Heap event with all of the defined fields.

Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was an error constructing the event.

Event

public Event(java.lang.String eventType)
      throws EventHeapException
Creates a new Event Heap event with all of the defined fields and EventType defined to be 'eventType'

Parameters:
eventType - The type for this new event.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was an error constructing the event.

Event

public Event(Tuple tuple)
Creates an event from a Tuple by copying the underlying field data. Once the Event has been constructed, the Tuple should no longer be accessed to avoid synchronization errors since they share the same underlying data structures.

Parameters:
tuple - The tuple upon which to base the event.

Event

public Event(java.io.InputStream is)
      throws EventHeapException
Reads the data for an event out of the given input stream and creates a new event identical to the one represented in the stream. This just calls the Tuple(InputStream) super class constructor. It does not check to insure that mandatory fields are present.

Method Detail

createEventArray

public static Event[] createEventArray(Tuple[] tupleArray)
Creates an array of Events from an array of tuples. The tuples are not checked to insure that the fields encode a valid event.

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Returns an object which is an Event identical to this one. All values are copied, so changing referenced objects in the original tuple will not effect the new one. In other words, this is a "deep copy" operation.

Overrides:
clone in class Tuple

getEventType

public final java.lang.String getEventType()
                                    throws EventHeapException
Gets the EventType for this event. This is a short cut so that the Tuple.getField() method doesn't need to be used. It is equivalent to (String)(Tuple.getPostValue(Event.EVENTTYPE)).

Returns:
The string representing the event type for this event.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was a problem accessing the event, possibly because it was corrupt.

setEventType

public final void setEventType(java.lang.String eventType)
                        throws EventHeapException
Set the EventType for this event. This is a short cut so that the Tuple.setField() method doesn't need to be used. It is equivalent to Tuple.setField(Event.EVENTTYPE, eventType, eventType).

Parameters:
eventType - The string representing the event type for this event.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if eventType is null.

getTimeToLive

public final long getTimeToLive()
                         throws EventHeapException
Gets the TimeToLive for this event. This is a short cut so that the Tuple.getField() method doesn't need to be used. It is equivalent to ((Integer)(Tuple.getPostValue(Event.TIMETOLIVE))).longValue().

Returns:
A long giving the time to live for this event.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was a problem accessing the event, possibly because it was corrupt.

setTimeToLive

public final void setTimeToLive(long value)
                         throws EventHeapException
Sets the TimeToLive for this event. This is a short cut so that the Tuple.setField() method doesn't need to be used. It is equivalent to Tuple.setPostValue(Event.TIMETOLIVE, new Integer((int)value))

Parameters:
value - the time to live for this event.
Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was a problem accessing the event, possibly because it was corrupt.

setTimeToLive

public final void setTimeToLive(java.lang.String longString)
                         throws EventHeapException
Sets the TimeToLive for this event by parsing the passed in string into a long. This is a short cut so that the Tuple.setField() method doesn't need to be used. It is equivalent to Tuple.setPostValueString(Event.TIMETOLIVE, longString)

Throws:
EventHeapException - An exception is thrown if there was a problem accessing the event, possibly because it was corrupt.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a human readable representation of the event in abbreviated form, displaying only EventType and source from the standard fields. Use toStringComplete() to get a multi-line complete representation of the string.

Overrides:
toString in class Tuple
Returns:
human readable representation of the event

toStringComplete

public java.lang.String toStringComplete()
Returns a complete multi line string with information on all of the event fields. Equivalent to Tuple.toString(). For an abbreviated one line representation use toString().

Returns:
human readable representation of the event
